title: How to Disable and Turn Off the SharePlay Feature in iOS, macOS, and Apple TV

steps.title: Open the Settings app on your iPhone or iPad .
steps.content: Open the Settings app on your iPhone or iPad . It has an icon that resembles two silver gears. Tap the Settings icon on your Home screen to open the Settings menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap FaceTime.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap FaceTime . It's next to a green icon with an image that resembles a camera.

steps.title: Tap SharePlay.
steps.content: Tap SharePlay . It's in the FaceTime menu.

steps.title: Turn SharePlay off.
steps.content: Turn SharePlay off. To do so, tap the toggle switch next to "SharePlay." Alternatively, you can tap the toggle switch next to individual apps to turn off SharePlay for those apps.

steps.title: Open the Settings menu.
steps.content: Open the Settings menu. It has an icon that resembles two silver gears. Tap the Settings icon on your Home screen to open the Settings menu.

steps.title: Tap Screen Time.
steps.content: Tap Screen Time . It has a purple icon with an image that resembles an hourglass. The Screen Time settings allow you to restrict the type of content that is allowed on a device as well as the number of hours an individual is allowed to use the device.

steps.title: Tap Content & Privacy Restrictions.
steps.content: Tap Content & Privacy Restrictions . It's next to a red icon that has an image of a circle with a line through it.

steps.title: Enable Content and Privacy Restrictions.
steps.content: Enable Content and Privacy Restrictions. To do so, tap the toggle switch at the top of the menu to turn Content and Privacy Restrictions on.

steps.title: Tap Allowed apps.
steps.content: Tap Allowed apps . It's in the Content & Privacy Restrictions menu. This menu allows you to block apps on your iPhone or iPad .

steps.title: Tap the toggle switch next to "SharePlay."
steps.content: Tap the toggle switch next to "SharePlay." This blocks SharePlay on your iPhone or iPad. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open FaceTime on your Mac.
steps.content: Open FaceTime on your Mac. FaceTime has a green icon with an image that resembles a camera. Click the FaceTime icon in the Dock at the bottom of the screen, or in your Applications folder.

steps.title: Click the FaceTime.
steps.content: Click the FaceTime . It's in the menu bar at the top of the screen. This displays the FaceTime menu.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's at the top of the FaceTime Menu. On older versions of macOS, this may say Preferences instead of "Settings." [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the SharePlay tab.
steps.content: Click the SharePlay tab. It's the second tab at the top.

steps.title: Uncheck "SharePlay."
steps.content: Uncheck "SharePlay." This will disable SharePlay for FaceTime on your Mac. Alternatively, you can uncheck which apps you want to allow SharePlay to use in FaceTime. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Settings menu.
steps.content: Open the Settings menu. The Settings menu has an icon that resembles two silver gears. You can find it on the Home screen of your Apple TV.

steps.title: Select Users and Accounts.
steps.content: Select Users and Accounts . It's in the Settings menu near the top.

steps.title: Select your username.
steps.content: Select your username. This is the username for your account.

steps.title: Select Share with you.
steps.content: Select Share with you . It's in your username menu.

steps.title: Turn it off.
steps.content: Turn it off. To do so, select the toggle switch. [4] X Research source
